flags.name: admin-host
flags.description: The host and port on which to start the admin server (in the format host:port)

flags.name: allow-skipped-files
flags.description: Make files specified in the app.yaml "skip_files" or "static" clauses readable by the application.

flags.name: api-host
flags.description: The host and port on which to start the API server (in the format host:port)

flags.name: appidentity-email-address
flags.description: Email address associated with a service account that has a downloadable key. May be None for no local application identity.

flags.name: appidentity-private-key-path
flags.description: Path to private key file associated with service account (.pem format). Must be set if appidentity-email-address is set.

flags.name: auth-domain
flags.description: Name of the authorization domain to use

flags.name: blobstore-path
flags.description: Path to directory used to store blob contents (defaults to a subdirectory of --storage-path if not set)

flags.name: clear-datastore
flags.description: Clear the datastore on startup

flags.name: datastore-consistency-policy
flags.description: The policy to apply when deciding whether a datastore write should appear in global queries

flags.name: datastore-path
flags.description: Path to a file used to store datastore contents (defaults to a file in --storage-path if not set)

flags.name: default-gcs-bucket-name
flags.description: Default Google Cloud Storage bucket name

flags.name: docker-host
flags.description: DEPRECATED. Please use the DOCKER_HOST environment variable. instead

flags.name: enable-mvm-logs
flags.description: Enable logs collection and display in local Admin Console for Managed VM modules.

flags.name: enable-sendmail
flags.description: Use the "sendmail" tool to transmit e-mail sent using the Mail API (ignored if --smtp-host is set)

flags.name: host
flags.description: The host and port on which to start the local web server (in the format host:port

flags.name: jvm-flag
flags.description: Additional arguments to pass to the java command when launching an instance of the app. May be specified more than once. Example: --jvm-flag=-Xmx1024m --jvm-flag=-Xms256m

flags.name: log-level
flags.description: The minimum verbosity of logs from your app that will be displayed in the terminal. (debug, info, warning, critical, error) Defaults to current verbosity setting.

flags.name: logs-path
flags.description: Path to a file used to store request logs (defaults to a file in --storage-path if not set)

flags.name: max-module-instances
flags.description: The maximum number of runtime instances that can be started for a particular module - the value can be an integer, in which case all modules are limited to that number of instances, or a comma-separated list of module:max_instances, e.g. default:5,backend:3

flags.name: php-executable-path
flags.description: The full path to the PHP executable to use to run your PHP module.

flags.name: python-startup-script
flags.description: The script to run at the startup of new Python runtime instances (useful for tools such as debuggers)

flags.name: require-indexes
flags.description: Generate an error on datastore queries that require a composite index not found in index.yaml

flags.name: show-mail-body
flags.description: Logs the contents of e-mails sent using the Mail API

flags.name: smtp-allow-tls
flags.description: Allow TLS to be used when the SMTP server announces TLS support (ignored if --smtp-host is not set)

flags.name: smtp-host
flags.description: The host and port of an SMTP server to use to transmit e-mail sent using the Mail API, in the format host:port

flags.name: smtp-password
flags.description: Password to use when connecting to the SMTP server specified with --smtp-host

flags.name: smtp-user
flags.description: Username to use when connecting to the SMTP server specified with --smtp-host

flags.name: storage-path
flags.description: The default location for storing application data. Can be overridden for specific kinds of data using --datastore-path, --blobstore-path, and/or --logs-path

flags.name: use-mtime-file-watcher
flags.description: Use mtime polling for detecting source code changes - useful if modifying code from a remote machine using a distributed file system
